predicate.note: Frames file for 'enhance' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry. No comparison.

role.descr: enhanced by how much, EXT or MNR

example.name: agentive transitive
example.text: Courtaulds has been under pressure *trace* to enhance shareholder value since takeover speculators -- including Australian financier Kerry Packer -- surfaced holding small stakes last year.

example.name: instrumental subject
example.text: In a statement, Arnold B. McKinnon, chairman and chief executive officer, noted that the new repurchase program ``should serve *trace* to enhance shareholder value.''

example.name: passivized instrumental subject
example.text: The quarter-to-quarter comparison was also enhanced *trace* by charges taken in the year-earlier period, including $11 million related to the modernization of a pulp and newsprint mill in Alabama.
example.arg: charges taken in the year-earlier period, including $11 million related to the modernization of a pulp and newsprint mill in Alabama

example.name: with extent PP
example.text: The company estimated that the transaction would enhance its book value by more than $100 million.

example.name: with agent and instrument
example.text: John enhanced his reputation as a smooth operator by throwing rocks at Mary's mailbox.
example.arg: his reputation as a smooth operator
